snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said that he would act unilaterally for employees on the state’s payroll, placing New York’s public workers far ahead of other states on minimum wage.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo, using executive authority, says he will unilaterally increase wages earned by state workers to $15 per hour, placing New York at forefront of nationwide movement to raise minimum wage; increase, to be phased in gradually over number of years, puts wage earned by New York State public workers significantly higher than in other states; hike is set to take hold in New York City by 2018 and elsewhere by 2021.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said that he would act unilaterally for employees on the state’s payroll, placing New York’s public workers far ahead of other states on minimum wage.

headline.main: Cuomo to Raise Minimum Wage to $15 for All New York State Employees
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Raising Minimum Pay for State Jobs
